title: 243-E
statement: E. Matrixtime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutLet's consider ann×nsquare matrix, consisting of digits one and zero.We'll consider a matrixgood, if it meets the following condition: in each row of the matrix all ones go in one group. That is, each row of the matrix looks like that00...0011...1100...00(or simply consists of zeroes if it has no ones).You are given matrixaof sizen×n, consisting of zeroes and ones. Your task is to determine whether you can get a good matrixbfrom it by rearranging the columns or not.InputThe first line contains integern(1 ≤n≤ 500) — the size of matrixa.Each ofnfollowing lines containsncharacters "0" and "1" — matrixa. Note that the characters are written without separators.OutputPrint "YES" in the first line, if you can rearrange the matrix columns so as to get a good matrixb. In the nextnlines print the good matrixb. If there are multiple answers, you are allowed to print any of them.If it is impossible to get a good matrix, print "NO".ExamplesInput6100010110110011001010010000100011001OutputYES011000111100000111001100100000000111Input3110101011OutputNO

processed.result: You are given a grid of 0s and 1s.  Can you rearrange the columns so that each row has all the 1s grouped together? If so, show the rearranged grid. If not, say "no".

You are given a square matrix of size $n \times n$ filled with 0s and 1s.  

A matrix is considered "good" if all the 1s in each row are grouped together. For example:

*  A good matrix could look like this: 
   ```
   00111000
   00111000
   ```

*  A matrix like this is NOT good:
   ```
   01010101
   10101010
   ```

Your task is to determine if you can rearrange the columns of the given matrix to make it "good". If you can, print "YES" followed by the rearranged "good" matrix. If it's impossible to make the matrix "good", print "NO".
